title: Are Your 2021 Disaster Losses Tax Deductible? Congress Will Decide
sub_head: Lots of Americans have suffered property damage from fires, storms and winter freezes this year. More generous write-offs for losses may be on the way.
body:
If you’ve had property damage from a disaster like a fire or flood this year, will the losses be tax deductible? For millions of Americans, the answer depends on what Congress does in the next few months.
So far this year, there have been 18 weather-related disasters across the country costing more than $1 billion each, according to the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration. That compares with an average of 16 per year for 2016 through 2020. This year’s disasters include some doozies: the winter freezes in Texas and Oklahoma, wildfires in California and Hurricane Ida on the Gulf Coast and the Northeast.
